meanings.definition: An underground passage or tube for vehicles, pedestrians, or utilities.
meanings.sent1: The miners dug a tunnel to connect the two caves.
meanings.sent2: The subway train sped through the dark tunnel.
meanings.sent3: The ants built a tunnel to reach their food storage.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts traveled through a tunnel of memories.
meanings.sent5: The tunnel was so narrow, I had to walk sideways to get through.

meanings.definition: To make a tunnel or tunnels through or under.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers will tunnel through the mountain to build the road.
meanings.sent2: The rabbits tunnel under the fence to escape the garden.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to tunnel through the snow like little moles.
meanings.sent4: She had to tunnel through paperwork to find the important document.
meanings.sent5: The mole expertly tunneled through the soft soil, searching for worms.
